Kpop Demon Hunters Vans Collab: Shop Online
classification_notes: Strategy & Miscellaneous News -> General News & Strategy

facts.category_path: Strategy & Miscellaneous News -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Commentary: Vans taps into ‘Kpop Demon Hunters’ phenomenon with new footwear collection
summary_bullets: Commentary: Vans taps into ‘Kpop Demon Hunters’ phenomenon with new footwear collection

Vans is releasing a Kpop Demon Hunters capsule that places HUNTR/X and their guardians on Classic Slip-On and Sk8-Hi silhouettes while Saja Boys–themed designs appear on Old Skool and Old Skool V styles, with the collection available in stores and online.
The line applies the show’s neon-tinged aesthetic and Vans’ checkerboard motif across core footwear silhouettes, integrating character artwork and demon-inspired patterns.

The collab expands a broad merchandising push for the franchise that already includes sold-out figurines, a viral streetwear drop with A.C.D.C., a top-performing Etude House beauty crossover, and a tour hoodie that crashed servers.

facts.category_path: Strategy & Miscellaneous News -> General News & Strategy -> Strategy
facts.content_line: Netflix named Mattel and Hasbro as global "co-master" toy licensees for the property, an unprecedented dual co-master structure.
summary_bullets: Netflix named Mattel and Hasbro as global "co-master" toy licensees for the property, an unprecedented dual co-master structure.
Products from both companies will reach retail in spring 2026.

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> TV -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Netflix is leveraging the show’s popularity to build a licensing-first franchise, rapidly layering apparel, beauty, toys and food tie-ins.
summary_bullets: Netflix is leveraging the show’s popularity to build a licensing-first franchise, rapidly layering apparel, beauty, toys and food tie-ins.
